intro: Dissotis cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are similar in texture to yams and are used in various culinary applications. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value is also appreciated due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
